definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]

sentences.english: The neurotoxic effects of manganese exposure in the workplace are well known.
sentences.chinese: 众所周知，工作场所的锰有神经毒素的效果。

sentences.english: In fact, we take our pillows, we douse them in a neurotoxin.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，我们买的枕头，有些是浸泡到神经毒素里。

sentences.english: Still, it can also be assumed the more comprehensive lists of known animal and human neurotoxins will likely have impacts to fetuses.
sentences.chinese: 假定已知的动物和人类神经毒素很可能会影响胎儿。

sentences.english: Such immersion is accompanied by mind-altering neurotoxins which keep the victim docile.
sentences.chinese: 在这种融合的同时，致幻神经毒素能保持受害者顺从。

sentences.english: Lead is putatively regarded as an environmental neurotoxicant.
sentences.chinese: 铅是一种广为人知的环境神经毒素。

sentences.english: Researchers will search for varieties with low levels of this neurotoxin.
sentences.chinese: 科学家将寻找含有最低浓度的这种神经毒素的品种。

pinyin: rou4 du2 gan3 jun1 du2 su4

definition: histamine (a biogenic amine involved in local immune responses)
a poison/a toxic agent/poison gas/a chemical weapon

pinyin: zhong1 shu1 shen2 jing1 xi4 tong3

definition: acetylcholine ACh (amine related to vitamin B complex)
